page.title: 04Social concerns
page.content: A survey amongst young people and their parents when asked for their main worries resulted in the following four major concerns: a). Money - Would the family be able to meet all the bills and continue to feed and clothe itself. b). Employment - Would the parents retain their jobs and will there be work for their children when they leave school. c). Drugs - With evidence of glue sniffing to be found in Kemsley, and daily national news of wider and harder abuses, parents are concerned as to how they can prevent their own childrens involvement. d). Vandalism - General concern over the apparent need for youngsters to smash things and create graffitti with paint spray cans.
